channel.title: JDK 6.0, "javac"
channel.description:
:) Hallo people, I have a few questions About JDK 6.0 and "javac".
First off when I try to Complile+Run, [img]http://[/http://i191.photobucket.com/albums/z218/ConnorzK/CommandPrompt.jpg[/img]
"Error" You do not have JDK 5.0 or JDK 6.0. Go to ownz's tutorial on the Moparscape Tutorial section for step-by-step instructions link to download the newest JDK update. Press any key to continue . . .
--------------------------------------- Hmm, interesting, I already have JDK 6.0 downloaded...and yet it continues to bring up this Error...Any ideas on what went wrong?
------------------------------------------
Now the "javac" thing...
Javac is not recognized as a external or internal command...
------------------- Someone help me plz! -------------------

item.title: JDK 6.0, "javac"
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

[quote=“io9, post:7, topic:127979”]http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,70709.0.html

New versions of Java don’t work with Taharok’s compiler.[/quote]
Out of curiosity, why wouldn’t his compiler be compatible with newer Java versions? I haven’t been through the source fully, but I can’t think of anything off the top of my head that would conflict and couldn’t be easily fixed…

Read full topic

item.title: JDK 6.0, "javac"
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

exe626:

First of all, You might get better answers on www.moparisthebest.com/smf. Second of all, if you have JDK 6.0 and it says you don’t, your compiler sucks? If you don’t know what javac, how did you pass the test?

Or, class paths is not set?

item.title: JDK 6.0, "javac"
item.dc:creator: @pureg187 pureg187
item.description:
@pureg187 wrote:

Hallo people, I have a few questions About JDK 6.0 and “javac”.

First off when I try to Complile+Run,

“Error” You do not have JDK 5.0 or JDK 6.0. Go to ownz’s tutorial on the Moparscape Tutorial section for step-by-step instructions link to download the newest JDK update.
Press any key to continue . . .

Hmm, interesting, I already have JDK 6.0 downloaded…and yet it continues to bring up this Error…Any ideas on what went wrong?

Now the “javac” thing…

Javac is not recognized as a external or internal command…

Someone help me plz!
